pullRequest.body:
â€¦discrete_functor_obj_eq_as

Seems like `CategoryTheory.FreeMonoidalCategory.discrete_functor_map_eq_id` is an exact duplicate of `CategoryTheory.Discrete.functor_map`, except it was a simp lemma.

Is there a reason we don't have a deprecated alias?

> Is there a reason we don't have a deprecated alias?

no, I simply forgot to do it. Will fix it later today...

@Ruben-VandeVelde I added the deprecation aliases in #14791, please have a look if this is the correct way to do it. (I specified the complete name, I added the alias in the place they were moved to. Not sure if it would be better to add them in a place where they were moved from. I couldn't find documentation about this.

I think adding it where you moved it to makes sense. Lemmas *moving* is one source of upgrade conflicts users currently have to just live with. (There's a draft deprecation policy; I'll try to ensure this detail is included there.)
This was simp 1100 in the other file - did you mean to change this?
Yes, this change was intentional. I suspect the 1100 was only added to avoid the `simp can prove this` lint, but reordering this also solves it.
